results:
David Prior's films are absolutely awful in every aspect: terrible writing, atrocious acting, abysmal cinematography, and low budget (his brother always ends up as the male lead). However, they are strangely entertaining due to their unintentional hilarity. The storyline of nearly every David Prior 'movie' (if you can call them that) is essentially the same. Brave, all-American commandos unite to annihilate Communist villains. But unlike other garbage from the Cold War era, like Red Dawn, Prior's films are genuinely funny because of their outrageously exaggerated premises and acting. The most amusing part of Jungle Assault is the moment when Becker (or was it the other guy?) is summoned by General Mitchell for a highly classified mission in South America. The most comical line in the entire movie is then delivered, something along the lines of 'this is my roommate, I've trained him well'. Seriously? You trained your own roommate? And apparently, this is their brilliant plan to avoid eviction.

If you stumble upon these cinematic gems on any used video platform, just buy them. They are all hilariously entertaining, and even more so after a few beers. Watch them with a group of friends for an authentic MST3K-style experience. So far, my friends and I have managed to get our hands on Night Wars and Aerobicide, also known as 'Killer Workout'. However, the one I highly recommend above all others is Final Sanction, featuring the bizarre-looking Robert Z'dar.

results: David Prior's films are absolutely terrible in every aspect: the writing is awful, the acting is atrocious, the cinematography is subpar, and the budget is practically non-existent. It's mind-boggling how the director's brother always manages to snag the male lead role. However, despite all of these flaws, there is an undeniable entertainment value to Prior's movies, thanks to their unintentional hilarity. Each and every one of his "films" follows a similar plotline - a group of macho, all-American commandos teaming up to take down evil Communist villains. But unlike other Cold War-era garbage like Red Dawn, Prior's movies are genuinely funny due to their outrageous premises and exaggerated acting. The highlight of Jungle Assault has to be the scene where Becker (or was it the other guy?) is summoned by General Mitchell for a top-secret mission in South America. The line that follows is absolute gold, something along the lines of "this is my roommate, I trained him well." Wait, you trained your roommate? And this is their brilliant plan to avoid eviction? It's just too absurd to take seriously. If you ever come across these cinematic gems on used video, I implore you to buy them. They are all incredibly amusing, especially after a few beers. Gather your friends and have a MST3K-style viewing party for the full experience. So far, my friends and I have managed to acquire Night Wars and Aerobicide, also known as "Killer Workout." However, the one I highly recommend above all others is Final Sanction, starring the unnaturally-looking Robert Z'dar.
